question.text: The pair of <math><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi></math> orbitals involved in octahedral structure having <math><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></math> hybridization, are

solution.text: In the formation of <math><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></math> hybrid orbitals two <math><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi></math> orbitals of e.g., set [i.e., <math><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"></mi><mi mathvariant="normal"></mi><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">z</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></math> and <math><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>-</mo><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></math> orbitals] one ns and three np [ <math><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">x</mi></mrow></msub><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">y</mi></mrow></msub></math> and <math><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">z</mi></mrow></msub></math> ] orbitals combine together and form six <math><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></math> hybrid orbitals.
